I didnt find that information by myself, but maybe You can help me make sure that did public app is independent of user or did I should use a service account to create private apps? In case when creator account will be removed in future.

If you want a simple solution to ensure that a public app remains available even if the creator's account is removed in the future, you can follow these steps:
• Create a dedicated developer account
• Develop and publish the public app
• Publish the app in the HubSpot App Marketplace
• Document ownership transfer

Yes, you can use SCSS syntax for CSS in both your local development environment and the HubSpot editor platform. Compile your SCSS file to CSS using a tool like Sass in your local environment. Then, copy and paste the compiled CSS code into the HubSpot editor.

When using the `npx hs upload` command to upload files to your HubSpot theme, you need to specify the individual files or folders that you want to upload. However, the command does not automatically upload subfolders and their contents.
To upload all the files and subfolders within a specific folder, you can use the `**/*` glob pattern.
